node.title: 'There were elections looming': Ambassador adds political motivation to why French sub deal was scrapped
node.alt: The French Ambassador wearing a suit stands beside a window next to Australian and French flags
node.description: The French ambassador suggests Australia's decision to scrap a $90 billion submarine deal could have been politically motivated, given the federal election is just around the corner.
node.content: ["The French ambassador has suggested Australia's\u00a0decision to scrap\u00a0a $90 billion submarine deal could have been politically motivated, given the federal election is just around the corner.", "In a speech to the National Press Club,\u00a0Jean-Pierre Thebault also pointed to the potentially 20-year gap Australia is now facing between when our\u00a0old Collins Class submarines are phased out, and when the new nuclear subs arrive.", "The diplomatic fallout between France and Australia in the wake of the AUKUS announcement \u2014\u00a0and with it the news the French deal was being scrapped \u2014 has dominated Prime Minister Scott Morrison's time in Europe this week.", "He and French President Emmanuel Macron have been trading barbs, including the accusation from\u00a0Mr Macron that Mr Morrison lied to him about the fate of the deal \u2014 something the Prime Minister has furiously denied.", "Mr Morrison\u00a0has also been asked\u00a0why a text message from Mr Macron to himself days before the AUKUS deal was announced had been leaked to Sydney's Daily Telegraph newspaper.", "Back in Canberra,\u00a0Mr Thebault touched on the issue, saying it was \"fiction\" that his government should have been \"able to read in coffee grounds\" and foresee the ending of the submarine partnership.", "Mr Thebault also raised why the federal government did not consider, or explore, alternatives to ditching the French deal in favour of one with the UK and the US.", "\"It is so very remarkable in this context that since March 2020, this Australian government has never consulted with us, at any level, at any time, about a possible nuclear-powered option or the merits of nuclear propulsion,\" he said.", "\"Was there a hurry to jump into what is widely acknowledged is the total unknown, with so much spin, spectacular marketing, but no concrete\u00a0answers?", "\"Maybe, as mentioned by [a] prominent and knowledgeable Australian specialist, there were then elections looming.\"", "Mr Thebault was recalled back to France in the wake of the AUKUS announcement and returned with the task to help \"redefine\" the Australia-France relationship going forward.", "But it has been made clear the onus is on the Australian government to repair the damage caused."]
